notesStmt.note: Several of the extant folios have been water-damaged. Lacunae after folios: 1, 2, 8, 9, 18, 23, 35, 38, 46, 57, 69, 75, 83, 103, 111, 117, 149, 151, 153, 204, 212.
Eliyahu ben Shelomoh ben Shemu᾿el ben Eliyahu ben Aharon ben Yitsḥaḳ ben Eliyahu Firuz: inscribed, folio 3r.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: The commentary of Japheth ben Ali ha-Levi on the book of Jeremiah.

collation.p:
29 quires of originally 10 leaves each and 2 single leaves. Several quires incomplete.
Quires signed with Hebrew letters on the righ-hand upper corner of the first page.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Oriental square and semi-cursive script of approximately 15th century.

history.provenance:
Acquisition:
Moses Wilhelm Shapira (b. 1830, d. 1884), an antiquities dealer of Jerusalem: purchased by the British Museum from him on 08 July 1882, folio [253v].
